snippet.textDisplay: I love themes that go slowly, almost like a waltz. Just makes me want to get up and dance and sing.

snippet.textOriginal: They should have just used ducktales moon

snippet.textDisplay: I never liked this game. I take a lot of flack for it, but it just always annoyed me to play. I despise most of the music (which for the most part is the same track in a slightly different arrangement), and was never a fan of the level design or physics. It feels weird saying that as someone that loves Mario games to death, but sadly, this was the one Mario game that I just couldn't enjoy. Even in 2014, I can't play it without cringing.
snippet.textOriginal: I never liked this game. I take a lot of flack for it, but it just always annoyed me to play. I despise most of the music (which for the most part is the same track in a slightly different arrangement), and was never a fan of the level design or physics. It feels weird saying that as someone that loves Mario games to death, but sadly, this was the one Mario game that I just couldn't enjoy. Even in 2014, I can't play it without cringing.

snippet.textDisplay: Feel free to dislike. It is a relatively obscure GB game, and it is a little silly. I like the music in the game, though I've never played it. You're probably better off playing 3D World or something more modern anyway.
snippet.textOriginal: Feel free to dislike. It is a relatively obscure GB game, and it is a little silly. I like the music in the game, though I've never played it. You're probably better off playing 3D World or something more modern anyway.

snippet.textDisplay: You're free to think whatever you feel, but let's not forget, much of Super Mario World's and Super Mario 64's soundtracks were also variations on the same melody!
snippet.textOriginal: You're free to think whatever you feel, but let's not forget, much of Super Mario World's and Super Mario 64's soundtracks were also variations on the same melody!

snippet.textDisplay:
This was the first video game I ever played. A friend had gotten this cool new gameboy thing, and I'd been jealously watching him for a while. When she noticed, his mom made him give me a go. He was on the whale, where you go inside it and it's kind of fleshy and disgusting. I died to the first enemy because he never told me how to jump.

I eventually got a gameboy, and this game. To this day, I consider it one of the greatest platformers out there.
snippet.textOriginal:
This was the first video game I ever played. A friend had gotten this cool new gameboy thing, and I'd been jealously watching him for a while. When she noticed, his mom made him give me a go. He was on the whale, where you go inside it and it's kind of fleshy and disgusting. I died to the first enemy because he never told me how to jump.

I eventually got a gameboy, and this game. To this day, I consider it one of the greatest platformers out there.

snippet.textDisplay: First Mario game I owned as a kid (aside from NES Mario) was pretty damn awesome.
snippet.textOriginal: First Mario game I owned as a kid (aside from NES Mario) was pretty damn awesome.

snippet.textDisplay: I have such fond fond childhood memories of this game... i think i'm tearing up T___T

snippet.textDisplay: The Moon area was my favorite area from Super Mario Land 2!  I loved the fact that in order to get there, you had to ride in a bubble blown by a hippo and hit the upper exit lol!
snippet.textOriginal: The Moon area was my favorite area from Super Mario Land 2!  I loved the fact that in order to get there, you had to ride in a bubble blown by a hippo and hit the upper exit lol!

snippet.textDisplay: But this bubble blowing animal is also known as a hippopotamus.
snippet.textOriginal: But this bubble blowing animal is also known as a hippopotamus.

snippet.textDisplay: Not as catchy as Star Maze (what is?), which plays in the same world, but still a memorable and playful little theme. I feel like this game truly deserves a remake, it's my favorite 2D Mario Land game. The worlds were quite varied and I loved how most of them were unique, it wasn't just a fire world, an ice world, a forest world, etc. Giant Mario robot world was especially memorable.
snippet.textOriginal: Not as catchy as Star Maze (what is?), which plays in the same world, but still a memorable and playful little theme. I feel like this game truly deserves a remake, it's my favorite 2D Mario Land game. The worlds were quite varied and I loved how most of them were unique, it wasn't just a fire world, an ice world, a forest world, etc. Giant Mario robot world was especially memorable.

snippet.textDisplay: I prefer this over Star Maze
snippet.textOriginal: I prefer this over Star Maze

snippet.textDisplay: I have the cartridge for SML.  It was on the short side, but it was one of my more favorite Mario titles.  I haven't played this game yet.  However, I do have Gold Status on Club Nintendo.  I think I know which game i'll be getting for free ;)

snippet.textDisplay: SD, have you heard of a game called Mystery Dungeon: Shiren the Wanderer for the DS and SNES? It's probably one of the greatest obscure games I've played; with how good it is, it's sad how I've never heard anything about it. I don't want to reveal too much about it, but it's a tough roguelike where if you die once, you have to start the game from the _very beginning_, so it may not appeal to you. But, if you're okay with that mechanic, the game is very intriguing: because of its blend of art, story, and even its gameplay mechanics, the game feels real. Sadly, its most disappointing trait is its soundtrack.
snippet.textOriginal: SD, have you heard of a game called Mystery Dungeon: Shiren the Wanderer for the DS and SNES? It's probably one of the greatest obscure games I've played; with how good it is, it's sad how I've never heard anything about it. I don't want to reveal too much about it, but it's a tough roguelike where if you die once, you have to start the game from the _very beginning_, so it may not appeal to you. But, if you're okay with that mechanic, the game is very intriguing: because of its blend of art, story, and even its gameplay mechanics, the game feels real. Sadly, its most disappointing trait is its soundtrack.
